poem:
Black Voices

Sunday gathers tales—  
voices in concrete caverns,  
where whispered histories  
unravel like threads  
of ancient cloth.  
Uncelebrated, yet blooming,  
these stories rise,  
from shadowed pages  
to light.  
  
In every syllable,  
a world reborn,  
a tapestry woven  
with hands unseen—  
our shared breath an echo  
in the enormity  
of silence.
